title: Placements are pretty unbalanced
body: I'm bronze and i get matched up with gold-plat/diamond smurfs. yea i get carried bc im the worst player so i go support and try not to die (even better, try to make sure my squishy lane buddy doesn't die either). free win eazy game easy life

replies.body:
* So if they are smurfs playing on bronze accounts - the matchmaking isn't unbalanced. 
* If they are smurfs doing their initial placements on a fresh account - first couple of games are going to be mid-low silver which still get matched with high bronze (so still pretty balanced)
* The system can't detect smurfs and automatically match them in the appropriate elo, but they will end up climbing up there pretty fast. 

> If you, a bronze 2 got matched into a ranked game with a diamond player, that would be unbalanced. 

* Anybody can say they are a diamond smurf, especially if they got lucky and are doing well in lane. If you look at their match history and its super average, chances are they are a liar.

no I think he means that depending on what time of day and week you do your placements, after the first 1 or 2 games which will almost always be bronze-silver, if you win those two  you can sometimes get 8 or so games where you get matched with people from really high gold to low diamond and even if you only win 30% and get carried, by just focusing on not feeding and picking a simple and passive support like say soraka or braum and just playing as passively as possible; you'll end up in an elo much higher than you should really be since you'll win alot of mmr but lose very little for losses and end up getting placed like high gold or something. Although they generally drop reasonably quickly after that if they continue playing ranked. Depending on when you do your placements (especially in oce with low server numbers) you can get placed in a much higher elo than you deserve somewhat easily.

I don't see how this issue could be remedied though outside of the decay rate that is already being implemented. Though I do feel even lower elos should decay as well but at a very very slow rate so if you only do your placements and then don't play any ranked within like 4-5 months you'd have dropped a fair bit like 4 tiers of an elo bracket.
